item.title: #505 output
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:14, topic:221030”]If its BCEL you need to set the method. You create a MethodGen and you need to set the method in the class when you are done.[/quote]Err, I don’t believe so.

Since you would be using a classgen as a parameter in your methodgen constructor, and that classgen would have been the creation of a new classgen, you also have to dump the new class. Otherwise, the data is just stored in a ClassGen.

I could be horribly wrong, but I don’t think so…

Read full topic

item.title: #505 output
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

If its BCEL you need to set the method. You create a MethodGen and you need to set the method in the class when you are done.

Read full topic

item.title: #505 output
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

[code]Download of http://world1.runescape.com/runescape.jar complete.
Download took: 6795 ms.

Loaded 263 files
Runescape Build #505

  • Hooking RSString
  • getLength() returns FIELD int ij.q
  • getBytes() returns FIELD byte[] ij.B
  • getHash() returns FIELD int ij.J
  • isEditable() returns FIELD boolean ij.R
    Total updating time took: 11724 ms.[/code]
    I’m finally in on this, I just now need to start hooking some harder ones.

Anyone have tips on repacking jars? Mine seems to fall 360~ KB short. Also some on, I guess, “reloading” the class file?
I can load it, inject the method/field, but when I go to repack it the file doesn’t have whatever I edited meaning it’s the original file. I’ve tried loading them to HashMaps and ClassGen arrays but I’m still not sure about it. Hope that makes sense, I can always ask on IRC I guess.
Enough midnight rambling

Read full topic

item.title: #505 output
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:10, topic:221030”][quote author=the bank link=topic=290196.msg2342129#msg2342129 date=1216415410]

Jagex now only allows access to the applet params if you have a referrer :P.

what do you mean? like in the URL connection? :0
[/quote]Take a look at the new source code they added to the game page. You must have a valid referrer (followed the right link to get to that page) for the applet to launch.

i went straight to one of the game pages and nothing happened it loaded[/quote]Because you had a ref from whatever your home page was…

Try loading it via a loader.

I know as mine broke and we had to fix it with a dirty hack.

Read full topic
